intro: Clavija clavata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, often covered in fine hairs. Clavija clavata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
